intro: Fimbristylis composita, commonly known as the composite threadgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial grass-like plant that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with tiny, spikelet-like flowers. Its botanical features include a rhizomatous root system and a tendency to form dense mats in its native environment. Fimbristylis composita is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in wetlands and along stream banks.
